messages.messageBody:
Hmmm... People are identified with the friends they keep... I haven't
read the link yet Sec but I will. I really want to know how Fujita-
san was as a person...

As for the book, would you happen to know the romaji title? Ah well
drop me a line if you do find it... I'll keep my eyes open just in
case though...

messages.subject: Happy 4th!  Fujita Goro + Koga
messages.msgSnippet: I already mentioned on the messageboard that Fujita Goro had (gasp) a friend (just because he was quiet does not mean that he was anti-social LOL!) in the TMPD
messages.messageBody:
I already mentioned on the messageboard that
Fujita Goro had (gasp) a friend (just because he was quiet does not
mean that he was anti-social LOL!) in the TMPD named "Koga" (they even
lived near each other.

You can read about Mr. Koga at
(cut and paste)
http://homepage3.nifty.com/sineitai/
html/siseki-t-fujita03.htm
*the webmaster says that their families must have known each other
(sec imagines Mrs. Fujita gossiping with Mrs. Koga)
(go to the main page and see pics from the NHK studio tour)

3-hajime.com messageboard mentions a novel starring Fujita Goro
""Metropolitan Police Department -- album leaves -- the novel "
(no Wounds, I have tried I can't find the isbn number---but I really
want to!)

which I guess is connected to the stage play mentioned here
http://www.1to5.net/saito/event/asuikiru.html
***here is the connection "Mr. Koga" his friend is also featured in
this play unless ofcourse I am misreading everything

as we all know..."all characters shown in this play/novel resembling
real or historic people are entirely coincidental blah blah blah" yeah
sure whatever...

something tells me that a playwright/novelist did some serious research

*~* Have a wonderful 4th of July! *~*
